body:
To troubleshoot if scoop is at fault here or if Alacritty can do something about it, I'd recommend downloading the latest `.exe` from the [github releases](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/releases).

If the `.exe` from the releases works fine, but the scoop version does not, this needs to be fixed by whoever maintains the Alacritty scoop package.

Ah yeah you'll need Microsoft's vc++ redistributable. I forgot it was a dependency because it's so common.

We should probably add this to the readme.
@zacps I thought the idea with the redistributable packages was that they get packaged with apps, not installed by the user system-wide - can the scoop package not handle it?
(I actually can't find an official download for it, just Visual Studio addons for working with it -- I've never really done windows development stuff so let me know if I'm misunderstanding things)

issue.title: Alacritty needs vcredist2015

repository.name: Extras
repository.description: ðŸ“¦ The Extras bucket for Scoop.

issue.body:
As discussed in https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/issues/1972, alacritty depends on MSVCP140.dll and VCRUNTIME140.dll.

Haven't opened a pull request for adding the dependency myself, as I can't find any docs or examples of the syntax for adding multiple dependencies (since a single dependency is just specified as a string, how are they separated?)

Thanks

body: The Scoop installer is not written or maintained by anyone from the Alacritty project. I do not use it myself, and have no knowledge of it.
@zacps right, but it's the recommended installation method in the readme, so it should probably be fixed (which I opened an issue on scoop-extras to do)

just ran into this issue
Fresh Windows 10, Fresh Scoop â€¦ 

```
MSVC140.dll nicht gefunden
```


MSVCP140.dll not found

> Fresh Windows 10, Fresh Scoop â€¦

> On Windows, Alacritty also requires Microsoft's VC++ redistributable to work properly.

See https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty#other.

>See https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty#other.
Thank you for quick response. 

I did the following steps (without success) while trying to install with `scoop`
1. find and download MSVC140.dll
2. start Windows Explorer as Administrator 
3. copy the .dll to "C:\Windows\System32"
4. open run dialog ( [Win] + [R] ) and type  `regsvr32 msvcp140.dll` and press [Enter]
5. got another error

I give up trying to install this on Windows. I just wanted to give it a guick shot and thought `scoop install ...` would allow to do exactly that. Will try another day on Linux :)

I'd suggest to remove the `scoop install` option from the readme or at least put it further down so that people don't jump on it first :)
I have not tried chocolatey but it may have same issues because of VC++ dependency

> I'd suggest to remove the scoop install option from the readme or at least put it further down so that people don't jump on it first :)

That's perfectly fine though. You just need to install the VC++ redistributable, which is available for install and download from the microsoft website. Not download the DLL, but the VC++ redistributable.

This is likely already installed on many systems, though installing it yourself shouldn't be a problem.

Currently even the portable installer fails due to `VCRUNTIME140.dll`:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7347975/204472775-7830ec7d-4698-4e5c-aaa8-ea044f902956.png)

Is there a way to make the project compatible with the libraries supplied in modern Windows (Windows 10, Windows 11)?

issue.title: The code execution cannot proceed because VCRUNTIME140.dll was not found
issue.body:
For bug reports, the following information can help speed up the process. Please
describe the bug that you have found and what you would expect to happen
instead.

### System

OS: Windows 11 Pro
Version: 0.12.1

### Summary

Fresh windows 11 installation, alacritty is probably the second third party application to be installed. 

- Download Alacritty-v0.12.1-installer.msi 
- Run installer, install success 

Launch of alacritty.exe results in system error and won't start:

```
The code execution cannot proceed because VCRUNTIME140.dll was not found. Reinstalling the program may fix this problem.
```
